sen.j: 神武天皇祭は幕末の孝明天皇代に始まり、明治4年（1871年）9月に定められた「四時祭典定則」で規則化された。
sen.e: Jinmu tenno sai (Emperor Jinmu Ceremony) was commenced in the generation of Emperor Komei, it was regulated by `Shiji saiten saisoku' (Seasonal Ceremony Regulations) which was defined in September 1871, and again it was legislated by `Koshitu Saishi Rei/Imperial household religious rites ordinance' in 1908.

Jinmu tenno-sai Festival commenced in the generation of Emperor Komei in the closing days of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and it was regulated under the 'Shiji Saiten Teisoku' (the Regulations of Seasonal Ceremonies), which was defined in September 1871.

sen.j: その後、明治41年（1908年）の「皇室祭祀令」で改めて法制化された。
sen.e: After that, it was given legal force under the 'Koshitsu Saishi Rei' (the Ordinance of Imperial Household Religious Rites) in 1908.

sen.j: 昭和22年（1947年）に公的には廃止されたが、皇室の私的行事として存続している。
sen.e: It was officially abolished in 1947, but it is still continuous as a personal ceremony of the Imperial Household.

sen.e: It is one of religious services for ancestors in the Imperial Household; Emperor Jinmu was treated differently from other emperors.

sen.j: 歴代天皇の祭祀は、先帝四代(現天皇の前4代の天皇)は毎年崩御日に祭祀されるが、それ以外の天皇は式年祭（3年・5年・10年・20年・30年・40年・50年・以後100年ごと）にのみ祭祀が行なわれる。
sen.e: A religious service is performed for four previous emperors (going back four generations from the current emperor) on the anniversary of death each year, while a religious service is performed for other emperors only on "Shiki nen sai": 3 years, 5 years, 10years, 20 years, 30 years, 40 years, 50 years, subsequently 100 years after the death of an emperor.

A religious service is performed for four previous emperors (going back four generations from the current emperor) on the anniversary of their death each year, while a religious service is performed for other emperors only on "Shiki nen sai:" 3 years, 5 years, 10years, 20 years, 30 years, 40 years, 50 years, subsequently 100 years after the death of an emperor.

sen.e: Therefore, it is called Jinmu tenno sai (Emperor Jinmu Ceremony) instead of Jinmu Tenno reisai (Emperor Jinmu Annual Ceremony); reisai (annual ceremony) is used for the other emperors.

sen.j: 当日、皇霊殿で儀式が行なわれるとともに、神武天皇陵には勅使が参向し奉幣される。
sen.e: On the day of Jinmu tenno sai (Emperor Jinmu Ceremony), a ceremony is performed at Korei-den (the Imperial Ancestors' Shrine) to honor the imperial ancestors; an imperial messenger visited there to give condolence money.
